intro: Diplopterys pubipetala, commonly known as the Amazonian yoco, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant is often found growing in humid, shaded environments along riverbanks and in dense undergrowth. Its botanical features include hairy stems and yellow-orange flowers that bloom during the wet season. The plant has been traditionally used in folk medicine for its purported psychoactive properties.
